title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, there is no listing of children nodes.
EB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes should be listed.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Select a new data source that has no database/table/column information.
3. Observe that there are no children nodes listed.
4. Close the data set editor.
5. Reopen the data set editor and verify that the children nodes are still not listed.
